description: Construction of two x two-storey semi-detached dwelling houses with accomodation in the roofspace and associated vehicle parking (Enabling Development); construction of two storey rear extension and single storey attached plant and refuse store to Crossways; alterations to fenestration and installation of conservation rooflights to Crossways; construction of a single storey outbuilding for use as a garage within the curtilage of Crossways; and tree removal
decision_conditions: Time Limit
The development shall not be begun later than the expiration of two years from the date of this permission.

Reason: Required to be imposed pursuant to Section 91(b) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. The time period for the implementation of the permission hereby granted is reduced to 2 years for the following reasons. The development is permitted as enabling development to support the restoration and conversion of a grade II listed building, a heritage asset. The heritage asset, whilst presently capable of beneficial conversion, is in a declining state of repair and the Local Planning Authority considers it appropriate to reduce the time period for the implementation of the permission and the associated listed building consent to secure the objective of the restoration of the listed building at the earliest opportunity and, if the permission(s) are not implemented, to provide an opportunity to review the permission to ensure that the case for the enabling development remains valid.
| Approved Plans

The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) Site Location Plan; 4000 Rev A (Location Plan as Existing); 1000 Rev A (Site Plan as Existing); 1010 Rev B (Ground Floor Plan as Existing); 1011 Rev B First Floor Plan as Existing); 1012 Rev B (Roof Plan as Existing); 1201 Rev B (North and South Elevations as Existing); 1202 Rev B (East and West Elevations as Existing) ; 4001 Rev A (Location Plan as Proposed); 2000 Rev C (Site Plan as Proposed); 2010 Rev E (Ground Floor Plan as Proposed); 2011 Rev D (First Floor Plan as Proposed); 2012 Rev D (Roof Plan as Proposed); 2201 Rev D (North and South Elevations as Proposed); 2202 Rev D (East and West Elevations as Proposed); 2020 (New Garage as Proposed) ; 5000 (Site Plan Demolition); 5010 (Ground Floor Plan Demolition); 5011 First Floor Plan Demolition; 5012 (Roof Plan Demolition); 5201 (North and South Elevations Demolition) 5202 (East and West Elevations Demolition) ; 2061 Rev D (Ground Floor Plan as Proposed); 2062 Rev F (First Floor Plan as Proposed); 2063 Rev E (Second Floor Plan as Proposed); 2064 Rev E (Roof Plan as Proposed); 2250 Rev C (Front Elevation as Proposed); 2251 Rev C (Rear Elevation as Proposed); 2252 Rev E (Side Elevation and Long Section as Proposed); 2150 (Sections AA & BB as Proposed); 2151 (Sections CC & DD as Proposed); 2152 (Sections EE & FF as Proposed)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| Protection of Retained Trees, Shrubs, Hedgerows and Planting Locations (Demolition & Construction)

No operations (including initial site clearance) shall commence on site in connection with development hereby approved until a suitable scheme (Arboricultural Method Statement) for the protection of existing trees, shrubs and hedgerows has been submitted to and its installation on site has been approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

All protection measures must fully detail each phase of the development process taking into account demolition/site clearance works, all construction works and hard and soft landscaping works.  Details shall include the following:

o	Full survey of all trees on site and those within influencing distance on adjacent sites in accordance with BS5837*, with tree works proposals.  All trees must be plotted on a site plan**, clearly and accurately depicting trunk locations, root protection areas and canopy spreads.
o	A plan** detailing all trees, shrubs, hedges planned for retention and removal.
o	Soil assessments/survey
o	Timing and phasing of works
o	Site specific demolition and hard surface removal specifications
o	Site specific construction specifications
o	Access arrangements and car parking
o	Level changes
o	Landscaping proposals

o	A Tree protection plan** in accordance with BS5837* detailing all methods of protection, including but not restricted to: locations of construction exclusion zones, root protection areas, fit for purpose fencing and ground protection, service routes, works access space, material/machinery/waste storage and permanent & temporary hard surfaces.
I.	Soil remediation plans.

All tree protection methods detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the  site, unless the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority has first been sought and obtained.
*Using the most recent revision the of the Standard
** Plans must be of a minimum scale of 1:200 (unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority)

Reason: To secure the protection, throughout the time that the development is being carried out, of trees, shrubs and hedges growing within or adjacent to the site which are of amenity value to the area in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); the Hanwell Village Green Conservation Area Appraisal and Management Plan; policies 7.4, 7.8 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016); policies 1.1(h), 1.2(g) and 2.1 (c) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy DPD (2012); and sections 7, 11 and 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Tree Protection Plan - Monitoring & Implementation

No operations (including initial site clearance) shall commence on site in connection with development hereby approved until a suitable program of monitoring of all approved tree protection measures has been submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The monitoring program shall include the following:
o	Confirmation of who shall be the lead arboriculturalist for the development.
o	Confirmation of the Site Manager, key personnel, their key responsibilities and contact details.
o	Details of induction procedures for all personnel in relation to Arboricultural matters.
o	A detailed timetable of events for arboricultural supervision concerning all tree protection measures named in the Tree Protection Plan, including:
-	Prestart meeting with an Ealing Council Tree Officer,
-	Initial implementation of the tree protection measures,
-	Installation of the House Deck system, and
-	Final removal of the tree protection measures.
o	Provision of a report to Ealing Council Planning Department detailing the result of each site visit by the lead arboriculturist.
o	Procedures for dealing with variations or non-approved incursions into the construction exclusion zones as detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement.
o	Post development assessment of the retained and planted trees and any necessary remedial action.

The program of Arboricultural monitoring shall be taken in full compliance with the approved details.  No variation of the approved monitoring program shall take place without the prior written agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: In order to safeguard trees and other vegetation considered to be worthy of retention in the interests of visual amenity for the area in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); the Hanwell Village Green Conservation Area Appraisal and Management Plan; policies 7.4, 7.8 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016); policies 1.1(h), 1.2(g) and 2.1 (c) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy DPD (2012); and sections 7, 11 and 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Construction Management Plan

Prior to the commencement of development (including demolition), a Construction Logistics Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan shall include the following:
o	Construction traffic management proposals including details of delivery routes and HGV movements and details of any temporary site access/parking;
o	Details of construction hours;
o	Noise mitigation and monitoring measures;
o	Details of enclosure of working areas and the location of compounds for the storage of plant and materials;
o	Details of temporary lighting;
o	Dust suppression, fumes and monitoring measures, having regard to GLA guide 'Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition';
o	Wheel wash measures;
o	Site security during construction;

o	A drainage strategy to operate setting out controls of contamination, including controls to surface water run-off, water pumping, storage of fuels and hazardous materials, spill response plans and pollution control measures; and
o	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.

The Construction Logistics Plan shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of demolition and construction.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy 6.3 of the London Plan 2015 and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan.
| Samples of Materials

Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced (excluding demolition), and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. Development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the materials and finishes harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); the Hanwell Village Green Conservation Area Appraisal and Management Plan; policies 7.4, 7.8 and 7.9 of the London Plan (2016); policies 1.1(h), 1.2(g) and 2.1 (c) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy DPD (2012); and sections 7 and 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Hard and Soft Landscaping and Boundary Treatment

Details of hard and soft landscaping including tree planting shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the occupation of the development. These details shall make specific provision for the planting of at least six trees within the curtilage of Crossways and include details on siting, species and size.

The details of the hard landscaping and boundary treatements shall be implemented prior to occupation and retained thereafter. The soft landscaping details shall be laid out and planted within the first planting season following the commencement of the development or such other period as may be agreed in writing with the local planning authority. Any trees or plants which die within 5 years of planting, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased shall be replaced with others of the same size and species and in the same positions within the next planting season.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2 & 2.1 of the Ealing Development Strategy DPD (2012); policies 3.5, 5.10, 5.12, 7.4, 7C and 7D of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policies 3.5, 5.10, 5.12, 7.4, 7.8 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2015); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Vehicle Crossovers, Pedestrian Visibility Splays, and Electric Access Gates

Notwitstanding any details submitted with this application each of the proposed vehicle crossovers shall be separate for each property and measure 2.4m in width. Pedestrian visibility splays (measuring 1.5m x 1.5m x 0.6m height) shall be established for each of the three crossovers and maintained/kept clear  thereafter. Furthermore remotely controlled electric access gates shall be installed for each of the three houses to ensure that vehicles are not waiting on the highway to enter the properties.

Reason: To ensure that the development does not adversely affect highway and pedestrian safety and traffic flow in accordance with policies 6.3 and 6.11 of the London Plan (2015); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Side Elevation Windows

Notwithstanding any details submitted with this application, the flank windows on the semi-detached dwellings at the first and second floor levels shall be obscure-glazed and fixed shut 1.7m and below as measured from the finished internal floor level.

Reason: To ensure the privacy of prospective occupiers of the dwellings and neigbouring sites, in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and policies 3.5 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015).
| External Plant

The rating noise level emitted from any external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 2014, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of residents in the area in accordance with policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policy 7.15 of The London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Permitted Development Rights

Notwithstanding the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 1 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any subsequent order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modifications), no enlargement, improvement or other alteration to the dwellinghouses hereby approved shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties, the hertiage values of the listed building and conservation area, and the visual appearance of the buildings and the area as a whole, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); the Hanwell Village Green Conservation Area Appraisal and Management Plan; policies 7.4, 7.8 and 7.9 of the London Plan (2016); policies 1.1(h), 1.2(g) and 2.1 (c) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy DPD (2012); and sections 7 and 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
